info.name: Limbic lobe
info.description: The limbic lobe is that portion of cerebral cortex that surrounds the corpus callosum on the medial aspect of the hemisphere. It includes the cingulate gyrus, isthmus of the cingulate gyrus and the parahippocampal gyrus and constitutes the cortical component of the limbic system.  The limbic system also includes multiple subcortical structures such as the hippocampus, septal nuclei and amygdala.
